title: [K-12] Overseas Training Program: Flipped Learning-based Advanced Mathematics Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and statistics
context.additional_context: Designed as a preparatory course to experience local math education culture before short-term overseas training. Smartphone-based learning materials are the primary strategy

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three mathematical communication strategies for adapting to local educational environments during overseas training
Learners apply pre-provided flipped learning materials to solve on-site problems, demonstrating ≥80% proficiency in required mathematical theories

By the end of the 2–4 week course, learners will produce a mathematical analysis report (minimum 3 pages) linked to local case studies (e.g., traffic volume near schools, sales data from local stores), including four stages: data collection → graph creation → trend analysis → conclusion derivation. The report must achieve an "Excellent" grade in at least two of the three teacher evaluation rubric criteria: clarity, accuracy, and creativity.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
